page.title: 03FARMING IN THE CLUNBURY AREA
page.content: Usually round here farms are hilly, stock, and arable. In January we plant {winter barley.}In March and April we do{lambing}and{spring corn}in June. We do{forage harvesting}and in July we do{hay.}We harvest{corn from early August to early September. We finish{straw}about the same time and{plough}in November. We get about 300 square bales every 5 acres. The most popular tractor is the{Ford.}The baler picks up{hay}or{straw}and packs it then it ties it and sends it out and dumps it or puts it in a{sledge. Some{sledges}put them into eights and loose them out. A{forage harvester picks up{manure,}shreds it and with a very powerful blower blows it up onto a trailer. An{International}tractor has more refinement than most other tractors. Farming is the major occupation here.
